summary: This is a memorandum from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General documenting a voluntary interview of a Federal Bureau of Prisons Correctional Systems Officer regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The document lists attachments including interview transcripts, warnings forms, and prison records from August 9-10, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the OIG investigation into his death while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York.

events.title: OIG Interview of BOP Officer
events.description: Senior Special Agent and Special Agent from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted a voluntary interview of a Correctional Systems Officer regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Prison records date
events.description: Multiple prison records (Daily Assignment Roster, Activity Report, Logs, Count documentation) were generated at MCC New York, the day before Epstein's death.

events.title: Prison records date
events.description: Prison records (Daily Assignment Roster, Count documentation) were generated at MCC New York, the day of Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted an investigation into the death of BOP inmate Jeffrey Epstein.
A voluntary interview of a BOP Correctional Systems Officer was conducted on July 15, 2021, and was recorded and transcribed.
The document references numerous prison records from August 9 and 10, 2019, including assignment rosters, activity logs, and inmate count documentation.
The identities of the interviewing agents and the interviewed officer are redacted in this memorandum header.
The document is an internal OIG memorandum containing no recommendations or conclusions, and its distribution is restricted.
